article.headline: Kingfisher says first-half pretax profit to rise
article.body: Kingfisher PLC said Wednesday that it expects half-year pretax profit to come in ahead of the prior year's as like-for-like sales for the second quarter of fiscal 2021 rose and costs declined. The house-improvement company said like-for-like sales for the quarter ended July 18 rose 22% year-on-year, boosted by strong e-commerce and reopening stores in France and the U.K. Online like-for-like sales in May and June more than trebled on the year, it said. Year-to-date like-for-like sales as of July 18 were down 3.7%. The company said it benefited from cost cutting during the first half of the fiscal year.
